name: Ibis Hong Kong North Point

reviews.title: A good hotel for the right person
reviews.text: This hotel is not for everyone, but it is perfect for single travelers who need a clean, no-nonsense place to sleep in a city whose real estate price is among the top in the world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is truly compact, and Americans especially will find it hard to adapt to the -- yes -- tiny bathroom and lack of storage spaces. But Ibis is Ibis - you don't stay there to be pampered.
reviews.title: Aussie tripper

reviews.text: I will not repeat what others have written, but will instead mention a few things that I personally discovered on my very recent stay there:
reviews.title: Great view of the harbour but

reviews.text: 1. The restaurant I think is underrated. There are many eateries near the hotel, but they cater to the locals and tend to be noisy and disorderly. I found the quiet and clean cafeteria on the 2nd floor a good refuge. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food: the soup of the day was quite good on the two times that I used the restaurant, and the roast chicken dish especially was enjoyable, tasty and well presented.
reviews.title: Located 4 doors down from Subway, Free inroom WiFi and Great view

reviews.text: Nothing beat the location it’s about 200m away on your right from the MTR Exit A . Airport bus terminal across the street in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: All about Location!!!

reviews.text: Local market along the stretch of road behind the hotel selling all kinds of stuffs from perishable goods to daily necessities (like clothing, bags, shoes etc)open until late evening. Many illegal handcarts hawkers can be seen, It’s a interesting place to visit . Many eatries and bakery shops around this area, almost every few street you can find Wellcome supermarket. Nike Factory Store and few others along Wharf Road.
reviews.title: Nice staying..near the MTR..

reviews.text: Fast check in, got my room card in less than 3 mins. I booked for 2 nights on single room(harbor view), was delighted hotel upgraded me to a double room.
reviews.title: Terrible soundproofing ruined stay

reviews.text: Tiny clean room, comfortable bed, clean bedding, and fresh towel. No free bottle of drinking water provided in the room. Strong wifi. Overall satisfied and enjoy staying here, will definitely return again on my next trip.
reviews.title: a gem waiting to be discovered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend & I stayed at Ibis North Point in late August, 2013. The reason the prices are so reasonable is that it is not smack-dab in the center of the action on HK Island. But it doesn't matter, because it's an easy 10-minute subway ride away from the action! There is really no reason to spend the extra $100 to stay in Causeway Bay, Wan Chai, or Central, if you can just hop on the subway from cheaper & quieter North Point which is just east from those bustling areas. The hotel is nice & clean and the staff are helpful. We had a toilet issue in the middle of the night and they sent a repair guy over within 10 minutes to fix it (it turned out it was our mistake and it wasn't even broken). You're not going to get a spacious room here, nor are you going to have a fancy spa bathroom. But it's perfectly fine if you're planning on spending most of your time out & about anyway. We enjoyed our time at the Ibis, and would recommend it to our friends & family. It's a great bargain.
reviews.title: Great location, Great Price, Clean Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ibis Hong Kong, North Point, is a gem! It is a budget hotel but with lots of little extras like a free newspaper left at your door, free WiFi in your room, fresh toothbrush each day etc, and a restaurant on site, open til 9:30pm, which was great as we arrived late from the airport and needed a meal. We paid the extra $10 for a harbour view room and it was worth every cent. Our room on the 25th floor had a stunning view over Victoria Harbour to Hung Hom, suburban Kowloon and the cruise terminal.
reviews.title: Awesome views, convenient location, and budget price

reviews.text: The hotel is attractive, light and airy, with clean comfortable rooms and friendly helpful staff. It is easy to reach by public transport as the A11 bus from the airport terminates at the North Point bus terminus just across the road, so no need to worry about which stop to get off - just stay on bus til the end!. HK$40 for a 76 minute journey as the airport is a way out of town on another island. (The taxi from the airport costs HK$260+). It is located on Hongkong Island, about 6 subway train stops from the Central District of Hongkong CBD and Central Ferry Terminal, with Star Ferries to Kowloon CBD and other destinations. There is also a local commuter ferry wharf right at North Point, across the road from the Hotel, which takes you directly across the harbour to suburban Kowloon's more modern suburbs with blocks of fancy new apartments, an interesting return ferry trip to fill in a morning before an afternoon flight.
reviews.title: IBIS North Point Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The train station entrance is just 2 minutes from the hotel, in the same block, although there is a bit of a walk underground to the platform level.
reviews.title: Location - Location - Location

reviews.text: A very small room however considering the space constraints in HK, it is a norm. The harbour view is good.. can see Kowloon directly.
reviews.title: Good view, basic amenities

reviews.text: It is well connected, just next to northpoint MTR. food stalls are available almost at every corner.
reviews.title: Hotel with good seaview , value for money

reviews.text: The room is neat and tidy, however bathrooms amenities are not provided, so do bring your own. The bathroom looks old but the shower has ample space.
reviews.title: Close access to MTR but small rooms

reviews.text: The bed is movable so do be careful when sitting against the walls, it might roll... The bed was also quite hard to my liking.
reviews.title: Good value for money, excellent location

description: Ibis Hong Kong North point is located in the heart of North Point area. All forms of transportation are easily accessible with the Mass Transit Railway next door, bus, tram and ferry stops nearby.Make yourself at home… Inviting, modern, spacious and comfortable, with a cosy bed and a functional bathroom. Your choice from our comfort standard room or breath taking Harborview room. Your room has everything that you need.
